review_full: My wife and I were attracted to the ambience of this restaurant as we walked by and thought we would give it a go. What a fortuitous decision. The food was fantastic. I had the lasagna and my wife had a horny pasta dish. Both were very tasty and about €10 each. The servings were adequate for us but if you are a big eater you may wish to try something else. We also shared a single serve of the bread €1.50 which had a nice variety to choose from. The staff were friendly and attentive. We also a bottle of white for €15. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

review_full: I cannot recommend this place more! Myself and my parents stumbled upon this place having wanted to go to a restaurant across the road which was packed.  The waiters were extremely accommodating and friendly! We were welcomed straight away on arrival, and given a lovely table near the window. We ordered a stirfry and half and half of the cheese and ham board. It was absolutely outstanding, the presentation was lovely and the food and drink were great value.  We were really well looked after, the waiter gave us a cheescake on the house which was super tasty! When the waiter needed the table back instead of asking us to leave, he offered us all a free glass of wine if we moved to another table. Such a nice gesture.  We were so well looked after and enjoyed every minute of being in this restaurant! They have a moderate level of English which is also good for tourists, but I enjoyed practicing my Spanish with them as they were very patient! Would highly recommend.

The potatoes were absolutely delicious I found myself soaking up the remaining sauce with the freshly baked crusty bread!  The octopus was perfectly cooked and again delicious. We both cleared our plates!  All accompanied by a beautiful wine-Lacrimus 5 Tempranillo Rioja- so good we ordered a second bottle!  The service was attentive, but not invasive, quick and really friendly. Special mention to Rebeca, Jonny and Andres- thank you for making us feel so welcome. You’re doing a great job!

title_review: Truly exceptional, the friendliest place in Madrid
review_preview: We'd read a couple of reviews of this place, and were keen to seek it out. After quite a few difference Tabernas and Tapas bars, this one truly stood out, and we weren't disappointed. The atmosphere was perfect, not the glaring bright lights that some...
review_full: We'd read a couple of reviews of this place, and were keen to seek it out. After quite a few difference Tabernas and Tapas bars, this one truly stood out, and we weren't disappointed.  The atmosphere was perfect, not the glaring bright lights that some Madrilenian haunts suffer from. Felt modern, yet with its heart still truly in the traditional.  Food was exceptional, from the cheese choices to the truly outstanding Garlic prawns, and the service is among the friendliest we've ever experienced. in spite of it being quite busy, you never felt rushed. The waiting and bar staff genuinely made you feel welcome.  An absolute must-visit.

title_review: Very enjoyable tapa bar in the busy tourist area downtown
review_preview: Located on a small side street downtown, this bar offers good tapas  and super-tapas (for two people) in a nice setting where the music is not loud and you can enjoy a nice dinner  conversation as well as wine, beer or a selection of popular...
review_full: Located on a small side street downtown, this bar offers good tapas and super-tapas (for two people) in a nice setting where the music is not loud and you can enjoy a nice dinner conversation as well as wine, beer or a selection of popular cocktails (mojito, caipirinhas, sangria...) For 21 EUR per person we have shared four tapas and had two large beers each. Meat tapas are grilled with grainy salt and taste a bit like byte-sized Brazilian churrascas and come with a great sauce on the side. The service in English is adequate, and we have enjoyed our dinner. The beer was not as cold as we would have liked. The place is nice, and a pleasant experience in a zone where one may be a bit worried of possible tourist traps. Free wifi is available if you are willing to authenticate with facebook and share your email. It did not work for us, but no big deal.

review_preview: We visited on a Saturday afternoon. It was very easy to reserve a table via trip advisor. I would recommend that you do book a table as it is a popular place, which isn't a surprise!The service we had from our waiter Jose was...
review_full: We visited on a Saturday afternoon. It was very easy to reserve a table via trip advisor. I would recommend that you do book a table as it is a popular place, which isn't a surprise! The service we had from our waiter Jose was excellent - very friendly and attentive. All other staff we spoke to were also very good. It is the kind of place where they will not pass your table without checking whether there are plates to clear or to make sure you have a drink. The food was simply amazing! Authentic Spanish tapas at a very reasonable price and everything was delicious. We had a selection of tapas and desserts and enjoyed it all. The cava and cerveza were both excellent too. We ate at a number of places during our visit to Madrid, and although all were good, this was by far the best. In our opinion, Inclan Brutal is much better than some higher rated places on Trip Advisor.  If you can go to this place, please do! Our only regret is that we did not have time to return for a second visit.

title_review: An absolute must for any visitor to Madrid
review_preview: This restaurant is fabulous, the food is out of this world. We visited at 10pm on a Sunday night and the place was fully booked and no surprise because once you have tasted their food you will want to go again and again.The hospitality...
review_full: This restaurant is fabulous, the food is out of this world. We visited at 10pm on a Sunday night and the place was fully booked and no surprise because once you have tasted their food you will want to go again and again. The hospitality is warm and welcoming, our hostess was wonderful and made some great recommendations from the menu. The menu itself is small and select but the quality and the flavour of the food is tremendous.  If you try the ham and cheese crocettes you will be off to a great start, but leave room for dessert because your waiter may suggest a cheesecake flavoured with toffee and mango which is utterly heavenly. Best of all is the value you expect food and dining of this quality to be expensive but it's not. Cannot recommend this place highly enough.

title_review: Loved the whole place - especially the food.
review_preview: Lively, buzzy, welcoming and served us a great meal.  Young staff and customers but we felt at home despite the advancing years. We had Andres looking after us, recommended a cracking Rioja at a reasonable price. Salmon and avocado and Mediterranean salads were the starters...
review_full: Lively, buzzy, welcoming and served us a great meal. Young staff and customers but we felt at home despite the advancing years. We had Andres looking after us, recommended a cracking Rioja at a reasonable price. Salmon and avocado and Mediterranean salads were the starters - generous and fresh.  My grilled fillet steak was perfect, pink, melt in the mouth tender with not a scrap of gristle. A real classic. My wife had the seafood paella, huge and big enough for two with plenty of real seafood in the soft and juicy rice. Just room for a brandy. Thanks guys and Andres for one of the most enjoyable meals of our stay.

review_preview: The reviews here are true - this place is really excellent! Excellent food, ambience, and service! What made it such an exceptional experience was the warm and friendly service by all the guys (Sadly I only got the name of one the bartenders - Jose,...
review_full: The reviews here are true - this place is really excellent! Excellent food, ambience, and service! What made it such an exceptional experience was the warm and friendly service by all the guys (Sadly I only got the name of one the bartenders - Jose, who was awesomely friendly and nice) here. We arrived in Madrid on a Friday and had dinner here. We were seated at the bar and initially hoped that we could move to a table. However, we soon realized that the bar seats were the best spot! We could see the bartenders work their magic and chat with them, even free shots! When we asked one of the guys to take a photo for us, they all joined in for a group selfie. The awesome food and warmth felt made us decide that we would come back the next 2 nights (basically our entire stay in Madrid). When they heard it was our last night in town (on Sunday), they had to make it a memorable one. Jose had a round of shots with us and even gave us a delicious Three-Milk cake!! We also had free wine from the owner and gummies to pair it with! When we thought we were done, Jose offered us bread with pulled beef on top which was awesomely good. We left with a full tummy and heart. Most importantly, we arrived as strangers but left as friends. Thanks much guys (the owner, all the guys, and especially Jose)! Aaron and Florence Must try: Beautifully handcrafted sangria by Jose and the Spanish tortilla! (best we had in Spain)

review_preview: My wife and 2-year-old daughter recently had dinner here. We did not want a heavy meal so we just ordered half-portions and were surprised that they were quite large rather than tapas-size servings. We had Cuban recipe of shredded flank steak (ropa vieja), grilled vegetables,...
review_full: My wife and 2-year-old daughter recently had dinner here. We did not want a heavy meal so we just ordered half-portions and were surprised that they were quite large rather than tapas-size servings. We had Cuban recipe of shredded flank steak (ropa vieja), grilled vegetables, prawns with garlic, and grilled squid with salad (chipirones a la plancha con ensalada). We had glasses of sangria which were delicious but on the strong side. The prices were reasonable given the size (less than EUR 6 for a half-portion). The waiters were friendly. We arrived ahead of the crowd so we had a nice corner table with a bench against the wall which provided enough space for our toddler. Note that there isn't any space for a stroller at this restaurant.

review_preview: My wife and I had lunch here on a rainy Sunday afternoon.  Modern and contemporary design inside which was pretty basic, but at least clean and comfortable.  Very friendly staff who were all committed to ensuring we enjoyed our experience.  All very capable in Spanish...
review_full: My wife and I had lunch here on a rainy Sunday afternoon.  Modern and contemporary design inside which was pretty basic, but at least clean and comfortable.  Very friendly staff who were all committed to ensuring we enjoyed our experience. All very capable in Spanish and English. Jamon croquetas were fantastic. Gazpacho had a modern twist and was flavorful. My wife loved her T-Bone steak which had a strong grilled flavor and was tender and juicy. I pigged out on a paella de marisco myself which was way too much food, but I thoroughly enjoyed. Jose our waiter was helpful and recommended a nice bottle of red wine. The entire meal was delightful, very easy, and good value for money.  By the time we left the restaurant was fuldl, and the majority of clients were madrilenos. Not my favorite restaurant in Madrid as I personally enjoy a more traditional ambience, however I would recommend this place as the food was tasty.

review_preview: I am not a tourist, I do not live around here, but I liked it.A very small, little, intimate, cozy place; downstairs room for maybe 8 people on two tables, while at the ground floor there are 4 small tables with stools and a...

A very small, little, intimate, cozy place; downstairs room for maybe 8 people on two tables, while at the ground floor there are 4 small tables with stools and a counter. Little choice of dishes but original and different from ordinary. Do not miss the pulpo, the octopus, but also the other dishes are interesting. I ate of course few of them but could see the ones of my neighbours... Definitely a place for food lovers, nice and smiling service. Three smiling young girls and a young guy run the place. Nice soft music to enjoy the meal with. No idea if they have a menu in English, my basic Spanish was enough to have a very good dinner. Definitely a nice choice to have a good dinner. Will be back. Bravo!

review_preview: I arrived very early in the morning after a long flight at the hotel (Urban) and upon checking in enquired about reservation at their Michelin starred restaurant Cebo. The only available slot was for lunch that very day, and I booked. After a short rest...
review_full: I arrived very early in the morning after a long flight at the hotel (Urban) and upon checking in enquired about reservation at their Michelin starred restaurant Cebo. The only available slot was for lunch that very day, and I booked. After a short rest and a change I went down to eat. And what a great start to a short stay in Madrid. Absolutely superb; from the bread and delicious olive oils (3 of them; each one unique) to the desserts (again a variety of mouth watering delights). Every course (I did the full tasting menu) was perfectly presented, perfectly executed, perfectly balanced, and a feast for the eyes. And the taste of each was unique and a delight for the senses. Nothing (and that’s rare in a long tasting menu) disappointed. The service was excellent, the wine pairings just perfect, and the attention to detail a total delight. One of the better meals I have ever had. Simply superb!

title_review: Excellent cuisine and superb service in Madrid!
review_preview: Sazon Arte is a small restaurant and wine bar near Retiro Park in Madrid.  My wife, daughter and I had an amazing dinner there last night.   We knew it was authentic and not touristy because they had no English menus.   Our Spanish is a bit...
review_full: Sazon Arte is a small restaurant and wine bar near Retiro Park in Madrid. My wife, daughter and I had an amazing dinner there last night. We knew it was authentic and not touristy because they had no English menus. Our Spanish is a bit rusty, but with the help of our able waiter Ricardo (who spoke about the same amount of English as we did Spanish) who showed us photos of each dish from his cellphone, we were able to figure out what we wanted.  Among other dishes, the grilled octopus in a Teriyaki style sauce with avocado and thinly fried potato confetti was the hit of the night. The potato and onion tortilla espanola was also very good, as was the burrata with sun dried tomatoes and the mozzarella and eggplant tower.  Our server was extremely attentive and very helpful. The wines were inexpensive and quite good. All in all, the food was a huge hit and the service even better. We highly recommend thus excellent bistro - but be sure to book ahead of time (we did through The Fork on Trip Advisor) or get there early as it’s quite small. It will be worth the effort!

review_preview: I caveat the review with the fact I was starving having not eaten all day, but I LOVED the food here. Pasta can sometimes be quite bland but I practically licked the dish of Rigatoni Al Forno clean! Fresh basket of warm bread (lots of...
review_full: I caveat the review with the fact I was starving having not eaten all day, but I LOVED the food here. Pasta can sometimes be quite bland but I practically licked the dish of Rigatoni Al Forno clean! Fresh basket of warm bread (lots of individual ciabatta style rolls) and baked bread sticks was lovely. I had the biscotti dessert which was like an individual cookie, baked in a little skillet, with straciatella ice cream and chocolate sauce - again with the drooling and scrapping every piece of food off that dish!!!! Reasonably priced, with good service and friendly staff rounded out the experience. Highly recommend it here

review_preview: We went to the brutal bar after a recommendation from our friends. We didn’t know what to expect because the restaurant does not have the most typical dishes but it’s much much better than that. Every dish we ordered surprised us even more. My favorite...
review_full: We went to the brutal bar after a recommendation from our friends. We didn’t know what to expect because the restaurant does not have the most typical dishes but it’s much much better than that. Every dish we ordered surprised us even more. My favorite was the shrimp dish in a kind of shell. The taste from the fish/meat with combination of the different kind of sauces are so nice. I would really recommend this place but make a reservation before because it’s very populair. We were very lucky to have seats even when we didn’t make a reservation they did everything to help us get a seat. There drinks are also very good and they have a lot of different kinds of cocktails which are very tasty. I think they even invented some of them their selfs. I think this whole restaurant is very impressive the food the service and the whole atmosphere. Especially because the restaurant is placed in a street which you wouldn’t usually. My credits go to the enthusiasm of our waiter Nico he was very happy en friendly en got us even take a desert (which we didn’t regret). I hope you guys are lucky as well to get served by nico even if I think al the other waiters were very friendly en hardworking as well. And last the prices are very good especially if you think of the value for money you will get. Thank you brutal bar I will come back for sure and hopefully many more times.

review_preview: Superb food served with elegance and panache.Having read the reviews, we entered with high expectations which were then exceeded; the ingredients were the nonpareil of freshness and quality.Our waitress guided us through the gustatory voyage with savvy and charm. Each dish epitomised the...
review_full: Superb food served with elegance and panache. Having read the reviews, we entered with high expectations which were then exceeded; the ingredients were the nonpareil of freshness and quality. Our waitress guided us through the gustatory voyage with savvy and charm. Each dish epitomised the harmony of aesthetics and taste. Although some dishes tasted better than others, each was fascinating and unique.  In addition to the unabashed excellence of the food, CEBO’s point of difference is the charming demeanour with which it is served. They managed to make a 24 course tasting menu seem unpretentious.  Would recommend to all visitors to Madrid as there is more sensory delight here than at the Prado!

review_preview: We were fortunate to fit in a reservation during our 2-day business trip. It might not be a surprise that this restaurant is often fully booked. We ate the classico menu, which offers a tour of the chefs favorite dishes. I dined at a lot...
review_full: We were fortunate to fit in a reservation during our 2-day business trip. It might not be a surprise that this restaurant is often fully booked. We ate the classico menu, which offers a tour of the chefs favorite dishes. I dined at a lot of michelin starred restaurants across Spain, but Cebo ranks amongst my favorites. Imagative creative dishes, with a lot of flavour. The wine pairings are incredible and each course expresses traditional flavours with modern techniques. The beef and the anchovy are my favorites in this grand tour of flavours. Staff is attentive and has a good command of the English language. The only remark I have is that due to an allergy, the aspargues were left out in my dessert rather than replaced with something different. Looking forward to revisit this restaurant.

title_review: Sort of hate to spread the word😉
review_preview: I LOVE this place.  I found it on YELP which is odd that I even used it because I don’t generally trust YELP.  But thanks to YELP because they got me here. This place is amazing.  A great vibe.  Silent B&W movies playing on wall...
review_full: I LOVE this place. I found it on YELP which is odd that I even used it because I don’t generally trust YELP. But thanks to YELP because they got me here. This place is amazing. A great vibe. Silent B&W movies playing on wall over kitchen. Bartenders more like mad scientists. And a menu to die for if you’ve been - like me - eating fun but very traditional Spanish dishes for a while. InClan Brutal is an oasis of foodie modernity in a very traditional food area. It’s on a small side street. Better to keep it there because if it were on a main street I’d never have gotten near a stool at the front bar (which is more like sitting at a sushi bar except rather than watching them make sushi, you’re watching them concoct drinks). I’ll be going back until I’ve tried all the dishes. Also the smooth gazpacho in a cocktail glass was fun. And delicious. Last but not least, Francisco was ON IT. Great waiter!

For dessert we had the baked cookie with ice cream, which was really good!! The service was quick, the staff were friendly and the restaurant was clean. We ate at the gran via steakburger and virgen de los peligros. The gran via was more modern and had air con. Would recommend for lunch or dinner as they offer a lunch set menu (3courses for €11.50!). Great place!!

title_review: 3-star Michelin experience for a portion of the price
review_preview: The proposition from this restaurant can be scary for the stomach:  17-course menu guiding you through the 17 regions of Spain, offering a typical aspect of local food that can be found in each.Although it is a large food offering, we were surprised to...
review_full: The proposition from this restaurant can be scary for the stomach: 17-course menu guiding you through the 17 regions of Spain, offering a typical aspect of local food that can be found in each. Although it is a large food offering, we were surprised to be able to finish it. So the quantity and pacing of the dishes were spot on. As each Spanish regions has its own specificity, the tastes can vary from one dish to the other, but the pacing is made in such a way that there are no too stark contrasts between consecutive dishes. The place opens at 20:30 sharp. The welcoming process is very courteous and professional. The tables are very large, especially since we were seated on a 4-top, despite being only two. One thing we noticed is that the lighting over the tables is made in such a way that there is no shadow hitting the table. This enables for the white table to reflect and make the table look very bright. Also, it means that the pictures you will take will look very good. There is a proper kitchen area located in the back, but if you are seated at one of the two tables closer to the entry, you will be able to admire the prep counter on which the prep and plating of some dishes are being made. The service was perfect from the moment we entered to the moment we left the building. The dishes were well explained. The pacing between them was also spot on, not having to wait too long nor being rushed . The sommelier was very good at choosing a bottle for us, as well as suggesting special wines by the glass on top of our bottle, to better pair some of the dishes. Perfect. At 110€ / person, we think we robbed them for such a great experience at such a relatively low price. This place definitely earned a place in our top-5 best restaurants ever. It also beats the San Sebastian over-hyped Arzak hands-down, for only a portion of the price. We strongly recommend this place as a definite must for any food-loving visitor to Madrid.

review_preview: Cebo offers a solid 1-star Michelin experience. We opted for the Somos menu, which consisted of 7 savoury bites, 14 courses, and 7 sweet bites (so 28 experiences). The food was of a very high level, with interesting flavour profiles, lots of variation in textures...
review_full: Cebo offers a solid 1-star Michelin experience. We opted for the Somos menu, which consisted of 7 savoury bites, 14 courses, and 7 sweet bites (so 28 experiences). The food was of a very high level, with interesting flavour profiles, lots of variation in textures and some fascinating combinations and techniques. The level of all courses was high, with two weaker courses (see below) and three very strong courses (at the level of 2 stars).  The first dish we didn't like as much as the others was the hake cheeks. The dish had a heavy focus on egg, which made the dish feel very heavy and a bit monotonous. The second dish was one of the fish dishes (we think the turbot pinotxo, the one with the rabbit). The dish was too salty, although that could have been a problem with our specific batch. The wine pairing also could have been slightly better; the classics menu had 6 wines, which means a lot of the 14 courses shared wine. Some wines did not pair well with some of their courses. The decor is fantastic and feels very high-end and hip. The wait staff is amazingly trained and very friendly. We had the bad luck of a fly ending up in our wine, and the wait staff noticed something was wrong, came to the table and immediately apologized and replaced the wine. Thanks to the wait staff for making the evening feel so smooth and special. The 2nd chef even came to all the tables to ask how everyone was enjoying the food. The most fun part (for us) was that we were allowed to keep the menu, so we know exactly what we ate. Overall, the experience was amazing. We would definitely recommend Cebo, it was one of our better Michelin experience. I have great hope to see them eventually obtain another star.

title_review: Great way to taste Spain in 3 hours
review_preview: We ate here for lunch as a family while staying at the Hotel Urban.  Dinner reservations were 1 month wait, lunch we had 5 seatings available the next day, same menu.  We are very well traveled as a family and are more keen on variety...
review_full: We ate here for lunch as a family while staying at the Hotel Urban. Dinner reservations were 1 month wait, lunch we had 5 seatings available the next day, same menu. We are very well traveled as a family and are more keen on variety and experience rather than exclusivity. The set menu was intriguing so we opted for the 17 courses for all 4 of us plus the mid-range wine list. It was on the feather edge of too much food even after pacing ourselves. It took all of three hours to get through the selections and we enjoyed both the taste and presentation of each one. The staff were helpful and polite and the service was excellent. Given how some restaurants can be intimidating to the point of absurdity I felt the staff here wanted to share the experience of this level of service and quality with anyone interested. Give it a go and think of it as what you would pay for a tour with meals included while learning a bit about the country you are visiting.

title_review: CREATIVE, ELEGANT DINING MAKES UP FOR THE HOST SERVICE
review_preview: Cebo is located inside the Hotel Urban in Madrid.  We reserved this one Michelin starred restaurant in advance because it was relatively close to our hotel, and it was positively rated by both Trip Advisor and Google.  We checked out the menu beforehand and felt...
review_full: Cebo is located inside the Hotel Urban in Madrid. We reserved this one Michelin starred restaurant in advance because it was relatively close to our hotel, and it was positively rated by both Trip Advisor and Google. We checked out the menu beforehand and felt it was going to be a culinary experience, which it was.  Our first impression upon arriving inside was how nicely decorated and modern it was. We arrived early evening so we were able to be seated quickly and at a nice table. We should add that the menu is not ala carte and you may find it difficult if not possible to make exchanges or replacements. This was when our host/lead server proceeded to let us know the "rules" of the menu and restaurant. I'm somewhat expressing our impressions of the service for us here. Their menu is an evolving one and seasonal, so what we had may or certainly could be different from what others have now.  We selected the "our classics" menu without a wine pairing. I believe we could have selected the same menu with wines, and/or a slightly more expansive menu. Anyway, my wife asked if she could substitute one or two items, but was told "no replacements". That strikes us as unusual even for fine dining restaurants. Believe us, we have and did dine at much more elaborate establishments and never experienced this type of rigidity. Needless to say, our server's approach with us didn't sit well for us and influenced our experience negatively. Oh, on top of that, she was basically "ill served" to be in such a position. We did have other servers bring different items to our table, and they were more professional. That aside, the individual menu items were half very good and half not so good (there were 10 different servings on our classics menu). Regardless, all the items were beautifully presented. We specifically enjoyed the "spring onion and strawberry", anchovy, "costa brava" creamy rice (really delicious and creamy like a risotto), glazed beef (like short ribs), chocoratafia, and assorted petit fours for dessert (these were very creative and fun to play with). In addition, we did really enjoy our champagne and wine. However, we would not return due to the service experience. Our review would be lower except the food was that creative and tasty.

review_preview: I contacted the restaurant prior to arriving to request a special table of possible as we were celebrating my 50th birthday. Greeted by the manager and given a table near the show kitchen in the restaurant so both able to see the food being prepared....
review_full: I contacted the restaurant prior to arriving to request a special table of possible as we were celebrating my 50th birthday. Greeted by the manager and given a table near the show kitchen in the restaurant so both able to see the food being prepared. Went for the 10 course menu with pared Spanish wines, with each course and wine explained in detail. The food was amazing, and varied between one mouthful using your fingers to a small dish needing to be eaten in a specific order to appreciate the complexity of the dish. Also given 2 extra courses to help make the occasion more special and the desert decorated with happy birthday. All I can say is that this meal with live with me for a very long time, it was perfection. Some dishes had some strange aspects, with an anchovy ice cream but they all worked so well with each other. I come from a catering background so could appreciate the flavors, cooking styles and fusion of flavour’s. If you are going to Madrid then Cebo must be a place you must dine at. You will not be disappointed. Thank you Cebo for making my 50th a night to remember.

title_review: I want to but I can't.
review_preview: This place promised to be a high-quality experience. It was in every way, except for the food (hence my score of 3 not 5). The venue itself,  inside the Urban Hotel, was elegant and definitely had the wow factor, employing the right use of lights...
review_full: This place promised to be a high-quality experience. It was in every way, except for the food (hence my score of 3 not 5).  The venue itself, inside the Urban Hotel, was elegant and definitely had the wow factor, employing the right use of lights to create mood and ambience. The staff really looked after us. The dishes were excellently presented, the plates were original, had different shapes, colours and materials to them, they were a delight to look at, nicely framing the bite-sizes sitting on top of them. But there is where it ended for me. Obviously the strawberry dessert looked stunning; however, taking a bite it tasted artificial. The cheese was contained in an edible membrane, I just did not enjoy it's texture. Nearly every dish had something quite not balanced about it, perhaps in an attempt to make its flavour memorable? It did not work on me, unfortunately and at €200 I wish it did. In my opinion, presentation and beauty, rather than being used to enhance the food, actually out-powered and overwhelmed it.

Inclan Brutal was a nice surprise.  - service was friendly (George and Stéphanie and i can't remember the names of the others, but they were all equally nice).  - there is a real quality in the food, with a little backyard where the chef goes and pick up some herbs - the food is not gastronomical, but it tastes excellent it is is well executed, with a real attention to presenting it in a fun and pleasant fashion... I did not like the music that was way too loud for my taste, but i suppose it means i am getting old !  It is one of the only two places in the area that did not voluntarily put adds on on our bill :-)  the diner menu at 25 euro is really a good deal ! try it  I would go again if i were to stay in the area !

title_review: Best meal of our Spanish holiday
review_preview: He have just returned home from our holiday which included two weeks in Spain, spent between San Sebastian and Madrid. We had some great meals in San Sebastian, which included a visit to a 3 Michelin Star restaurant.Of all of the meals we had,...
review_full: He have just returned home from our holiday which included two weeks in Spain, spent between San Sebastian and Madrid. We had some great meals in San Sebastian, which included a visit to a 3 Michelin Star restaurant. Of all of the meals we had, our dinner at Cebo out shone then all. From the minute that you walk in the door, the service is amazing, beginning with drinks and canapés. The food is adventurous, looks stunning and tastes amazing - all delivered with some of the best service that we have had the pleasure of experiencing. Wine service is also friendly and knowledgable, and included a complimentary wine to accompany our magnificent desserts.  All of this was delivered at a very reasonable price for the quality of the food and service - smashed our Michelin Star experience. Stunning - a must if you are visiting Madrid!

review_preview: Restaurant Cebo is a 1* Michelin restaurant - and they very well deserve to be.1. First let me give a very special thank you to our waitress. You really made our visit great with your professional approach and great spirit, great humor og amazing...
review_full: Restaurant Cebo is a 1* Michelin restaurant - and they very well deserve to be. 1. First let me give a very special thank you to our waitress. You really made our visit great with your professional approach and great spirit, great humor og amazing personality. 2. second thank to our sommelier. You gave us a great tour around these very special and delightful wine menu(we took the top class wine menu - it consits of very powerful and special wines. Some even dating back to the 60's. Some tastet in the direction of port and some even with a touch of whiskey) 3. And now to the food. Restaurant Cebo takes you on a trip around Spain - with 17 small and medium sized dishes from the differen regions of Spain and with a Theme going from the mountains to the sea. Its very delicious and very well prepared - except for few of the dishes that didn´t match the high level of the others. The egg-foam the spargues was a flop and also the last treat of small sweets fell through . this was a pitty as this dish should set a final point for this great experience. This is the reason I only give 4 stars - If you go to a high end restaurant with a michelin star you should expect all dishes to blow you away. But definately worth a visit. We stayed here for almost 4 hours.

title_review: Good, but not as exciting as expected (3.5 stars)
review_preview: We were very excited to try this restaurant and the reviews were all very good. Restaurant ambience is nice and elegant, tables are large and not to close to others, that is appreciated. Service very friendly but not always as attentive as you would expect...
review_full: We were very excited to try this restaurant and the reviews were all very good. Restaurant ambience is nice and elegant, tables are large and not to close to others, that is appreciated. Service very friendly but not always as attentive as you would expect in a Michelin restaurant (we had to wait quite a while before someone came to ask us what we wanted to drink) and the waitress did not speak very clearly. Interesting and extensive wine list, good recommendation from the sommelier. Presentation of the dishes was very beautiful, some dishes were very good, there is good quality, but others were just ok. The “pulpo, pulpit” – octopus- was very good, the rice “salmorreta” as well, “cococha de merluza con esparragos” (hake with asparagus) interesting. What I liked less were the two main dishes, especially I missed some real meat (just a very small piece of cochinito - pig), that I did not like that much. There were some interesting textures, but I am more interested in taste. It is a good restaurant, but I missed the “wow” factor that I expect in a Michelin restaurant and have experienced in other restaurants, I was hoping for dishes so good to remember for years. I would put 3.5 stars if possible.

title_review: Good, but only if you dig the theme
review_preview: So we wanted to go to Rosi.    But they were full so they sent us to this place.  Probably the same owners.  It seems to me that it is all about image and money than taste and service.  They told us we had to be...
review_full: So we wanted to go to Rosi. But they were full so they sent us to this place. Probably the same owners.  It seems to me that it is all about image and money than taste and service.  They told us we had to be out by 9:00 since the table was reserved. Fine it was 7:15.  They were disappointed when we didn’t order the overpriced signature cocktails. The menu was, in my opinion, limited and somewhat confusing.. yes confusing even though we were given an English menu.  We ordered Sangria and Paella for two and a pork dish to share between the 4 of us. The sangria tasted watered down - the worst we have had so far, and we have had alot.  The bread took 35 minutes.  The paella took 45 minutes. To be fair we were warned that it would take 20 minutes. By comparison to the paella we had near plaza mayor, it cost 4 Euro more and had 50% or less calamari and shell fish. It was over cooked and tasted OK. The portion size was good... but it is pretty easy to make rice a big portion.  According to my wife, the pork was excellent, although a small portion  And we were basically kicked out at 21:00.  Even the bathroom was so weird my wife skipped a visit. No toilet paper or paper towels. And unisex! Fortunately it only cost 54 euro. But there are lots of other restaurants where you get better food and don’t pay for the theme.

review_preview: As Michelin rated restaurant first timers, we so much wanted to be blown away by a famous chef.  Instead we ended up only mildly enjoying our highly priced meal.  We don’t mind paying high price but do expect high quality.  Let start with what we...
review_full: As Michelin rated restaurant first timers, we so much wanted to be blown away by a famous chef. Instead we ended up only mildly enjoying our highly priced meal. We don’t mind paying high price but do expect high quality. Let start with what we liked. 1. Service was superb, our waitress was attentive, smiling, and catered to our every wish.  2. Decor was superb if you like industrial, dark spaces. I do.  3. Dishes were imaginative, beautiful, and varied. We chose a fixed price menu for 85 ear per person of 12 small courses (way too much food) while they also have. 17 course meal.  So, with superb service, amazing ambience, and creative daring dishes..why only two stars for this Michelin rated restaurant? It just wasn’t tasty. My wife and I had 12 courses (actually ate 14 or 15 different things); and found only about a third of them to be tasty, and perhaps only two or three to be up to expectations. Other dishes (lemon cake dessert, anchovy ice cream course to name a few) were just horrible. The chef, clearly talented...and the Michelin reviewers...dropped the ball. Since when is style more important than substance. In the race to find ever more creative and daring dishes, you forgot about taste. Perhaps my palate is not sophisticated enough, perhaps I am less familiar with local cuisine....or perhaps the chef is so much of a celebrity that nobody is daring to say...The Emperor has No Clothes.  Good luck. That’s my two cents. Obviously I am in the minority among reviews, but that is my honest experience and review.

Wine pairing was beyond superb .  Food here was incredible. You get a little bigger piece here than you would at other Michelin restaurants. Portions were generous. Price was reasonable. What else can I ask for?  All I can say is you won’t regret.  The only one thing here I would like is for the menu not to be presented beforehand. I like the idea of a surprise in each dish. Here you get to see everything you get for the nite. Not a usual practice in Michelin restaurants. But other than that, everything was flawless. It was the best meal in Madrid !

review_preview: Four of us tried very hard to enjoy this, but we all agreed it was one of the worst meals we had ever had, especially for the price (no a la carte, only two options presented, 85 euro smaller "tasting" menu, and 120 euro larger...
review_full: Four of us tried very hard to enjoy this, but we all agreed it was one of the worst meals we had ever had, especially for the price (no a la carte, only two options presented, 85 euro smaller "tasting" menu, and 120 euro larger one). Menu appeared to be based on the current culinary obsession with umami, with a heavy dose of 'past prime', attempting funk in every dish. The chef has a fascination with delivering the 'surprise' of an unpierced egg yolk that burst in the mouth, which appeared in at least two dishes and was revolting in the context of the unbalanced heaviness of the food. There was also zero balance in the range of ingredients presented, almost no veg or fruit, all dishes brown in color, and an unpleasant, unending stream of heaviness and lack of flavor balance, evoking disgust. Three of the four of us had major indigestion, two up all night with uncomfortable sleep from the meal, and even I, never prone to indigestion, experienced some. The red wine suggested was poor quality, plonk grade, only the white was a high note, a lovely sauvignon blanc. Sorry, Cebo, but for the price and reputation, you have to deliver, and diners are seeking great flavors and delight, not pretentiousness. The restaurant was virtually empty, which may be a sign of where this place is headed.

review_preview: Words can not do justice to the experience of dining at Cebo. On a bustling Saturday evening in Madrid we stepped off the street into the tranquil setting of Cebo. The restaurant was set for minimal convers which added to the sense of exclusivity surrounding...
review_full: Words can not do justice to the experience of dining at Cebo. On a bustling Saturday evening in Madrid we stepped off the street into the tranquil setting of Cebo. The restaurant was set for minimal convers which added to the sense of exclusivity surrounding the dinner.  The maitre de and the rest of the service team were attentive from the very start and throughout.  We opted for the Somos CEBO menu which consists of 16 courses over about 3 hours. Each course was completely different to the last and the menu offered creative approaches from savoury bites at the start to sweet bites at the end.  Our personal favourites were the rice with Shropshire cheese, the yolk pudding and caviar at the beginning and the truffle chocolate pie at the end.  The menu was paired with 9 wines, the majority coming from Spain and the sommelier guided us carefully through the selection.  All in all, a fantastic experience and a wonderful way to spend an evening in Madrid.

review_preview: Tripadvisor once again has guided us to a memorable dining experience--this one was pretty intense!We arrived at this restaurant, located in a top-of-the-market hotel where th rack rate on a room approaches $900, and were seated promptly at 8:30 pm--their opening hour, and the...
review_full: Tripadvisor once again has guided us to a memorable dining experience--this one was pretty intense! We arrived at this restaurant, located in a top-of-the-market hotel where th rack rate on a room approaches $900, and were seated promptly at 8:30 pm--their opening hour, and the time of our reservation. Immediately impressive: the ambiance of classy modernist decor with light levels modest but not gloomy. A wait staff that performs like you're the only ones in the house. A slight aroma of burning wood in the air. My wife and I went for the classic menu, a series of tasting plates. Early on, it was clear that the vision of Chef Morales is to generate maximum umami, and to make each course as intense in that flavor if not more so. The only break from the intensity came with a cool "sweet orchard" salad near the end, fresh with flavors of strawberry and chocolate to enhance the greens. Our wine pairings were also exceptional. From an aethetic perspective, I would have preferred a few more breaks from the intensity of flavors in the rest of the menu--but I have to admire a chef who has a vision and who pulls it off so spectacularly. This high-priced hotel requires a dining option of this caliber, and they have it.

title_review: A wonderful trip around culinary Spain
review_preview: Cebo mean bait although I am not sure if this is a reference just to the small portions or it is intended that the small  portions are bait  to get you to return? Either way it is appropriate. Beautiful restuarant located alongside the Urban hotel-...
review_full: Cebo mean bait although I am not sure if this is a reference just to the small portions or it is intended that the small portions are bait to get you to return? Either way it is appropriate. Beautiful restuarant located alongside the Urban hotel- under same ownership. It is a sort of themed menu- 17 dishes that takes you around all of the regions in Spain in a sea , land and mountain theme. That adds interest for sure and really works. The dishes are very creative and made from top quality fresh ingredients . Presentation is excellent. Service is very efficient tho not rushed in any way. This food journey through Spain is priced at €120. Option of wine flight or personal selection from main menu- wine flight priced at either €120 or €85 for 9 or 7 different wines- mercifully not 17 to match the number of courses ! The former ends with a wonderful old vintage Pedro Ximenez . I had expected all wines to be Spanish but they do include 1 French and 1 Portuguese wine- the Somellier knows what he is doing and wines did give a perfect balance but my personal preference would be for all Spanish Wines to match the all Spanish food menu- a small point. Restaurant is Michelin 1 star and it is a very interesting and enjoyable culinary journey. Restaurant closed Sunday and Monday.

The menu started with a lovely presentation of snacks, followed by several starters and rice dish all beautifully presented with delicious fresh ingredients. We then went in to a fish and meat course and multiple dessert options. The wine pairings were some of the most unique we have ever had. We were able to receive a copy of the menu and wine pairings for reference during the meal (although not needed with the fabulous descriptions from the staff) that were nice to take home with us. The service was wonderful, very accommodating, informative, and enthusiastic. The entire experience was upscale yet approachable and not at all stuffy! We loved this experience and would definitely return.

title_review: This is a true Michelin Star!
review_preview: We visited a few restaurants at the One Star level. Cebo stood out amongst it's peers. From the moment you sit down, the wide tables with space to spread out, no detail was overlooked. We had the classic tasting, which was plenty, but not overwhelming....
review_full: We visited a few restaurants at the One Star level. Cebo stood out amongst it's peers.  From the moment you sit down, the wide tables with space to spread out, no detail was overlooked. We had the classic tasting, which was plenty, but not overwhelming. The tastes are very telling of the chef, with the sardine a true Spanish "fish" style (If overt fish tastes aren't your thing, you might want to sub). The "classics" menu that earned them their Michelin Star two years ago still feels modern and inventive. Make sure to add the wine pairing which enhanced every course...and you're in for a treat. A true Star.

We had the classic menu which comprises of 12 dishes. Now as you journey through these dishes they will take you through a rollercoaster of emotions. You will have taste sensations and flavour combinations that you have probably never had before. My personal favourite was the anchovy but my husband didn’t like it as it was too strong for his palate. His favourite was the melt in the mouth Beef with a bone marrow sauce. All of the deserts are divine. I would recommend this place it is top end fine dining, with immaculate presentation and a tasty experience to not be missed.

review_preview: At the time of writing Cebo had received 146 reviews of which the last one was terrible and the rest good to excellent. On my second visit I was wondering had Chef Morales lost his touch, was everything really so bad? Thankfully the answer is...
review_full: At the time of writing Cebo had received 146 reviews of which the last one was terrible and the rest good to excellent. On my second visit I was wondering had Chef Morales lost his touch, was everything really so bad? Thankfully the answer is NO, Yes the style and presentation is different from other areas of the world but isn't that what travelling is all about, the first time I went to Japan in the 1980's I hated Sushi and couldn't see it catching on in the western world!!. This restaurant has if anything improved since my last visit in March. The tasting menu still represents amazing value and a good percentage of the dishes have been changed from my last visit, this makes a pleasant change to some places which have the same menu from year to year. If you want to enjoy a relaxing meal cooked by one of the best Chef's in Madrid and looked after by great people then give Cebo a visit, you will not be disappointed.!!!

The chef was even generous enough to give us a complementary dish but we could only take a small bite from this fish course and the final beef dish. The plating of the dishes and the service was impeccable. It was a great experience, despite our own shortcomings, and a meal to remember for its inventiveness and elegance.

Each dish is imaginatively created and presented to table. Dishes do arrive in rather quick succession which can be challenging on the palate but service has to be this way otherwise you could be in there overnight ! It was an amazing dining experience which will need to be repeated.

title_review: Worst meal we had in Spain
review_preview: This was the last dinner of our 2+ week vacation, and sadly the worst meal we had. The restaurant was recommended by the concierge at our hotel, and we agreed to go based on the favorable reviews.  As a background, I have been a wine...
review_full: This was the last dinner of our 2+ week vacation, and sadly the worst meal we had. The restaurant was recommended by the concierge at our hotel, and we agreed to go based on the favorable reviews. As a background, I have been a wine collector for 25+ years, with an adventurous palate, and have traveled extensively and dined at various Michelin rated restaurants in the US, Europe and Asia. Unfortunately, only 2 individuals in our group of 8 could finish their meals. From appetizers through dessert, the composition of this food is simply not working. There is no doubt that a lot of effort was spent putting the dishes together. However, all the presentation and technique in this world will not succeed, if the food does not satisfy the palate, and sadly, that was our experience. To cap off dinner, we decided to take one more risk by ordering coffee and dessert. Our capuccinos were served cold, and the one (1) creme brulee ordered was unfinished between 8 diners. On the positive side, the service was very attentive, and we were repeatedly questioned regarding our satisfaction, to which we politely replied approvingly. It was obvious however, that the majority of dishes were removed with food that was not consumed. The chef did make an appearance and questioned where we were from, stating that perhaps we did not understand this kind of food, but that it was very fashionable in Spain. I held my tongue to avoid a pointless argument, but at the end, so many in our company were offended by the remarks, that I did mention it to the head waiter. Unbeknownst to the chef, I have visited Spain 15+ times and am very familiar with the Catalan and Basque schools of vanguard cuisine. However, food must primarily appeal to the tastebuds, and if customers cannot "understand" a chef's cuisine they will not return or recommend the establishment, as we have chosen to do. Lastly, I would like to point out, that cost considerations were not a factor in writing this review.

review_preview: I found this spot on Trip Advisor and then asked the hotel front desk about it. From the receptionists reaction, we knew we had to go. I am VERY glad we did. We sat at the bar which was awesome, because we could see all...
review_full: I found this spot on Trip Advisor and then asked the hotel front desk about it. From the receptionists reaction, we knew we had to go. I am VERY glad we did. We sat at the bar which was awesome, because we could see all the magic happening in the kitchen and behind the bar. It started with two craft cocktails that were both amazing. We ordered 4 tapas and all were perfect. The tuna tataki and Iberian Ribs were my favorites, but the risotto and the undercooked Spanish Omelette were also to die for. We also got the red sangria which was great. Do yourself a favor and go. I suggest reservations, but we got seated as a party of 2 in about 15 min at the bar.

review_full: My friend and I had dinner at Cebo. It was the most amazing culinary experience of my life - bar none! From the service, to the presentation, to the aroma, to the flavor - an amazing experience. We both chose the Tasting Menu for our dinner. It was a lot of food, but we were able to eat it all. It was a little expensive, but so worth it! The modern, yet understated decor of the restaurant was pleasing, but kept the focus on the food. The service was impeccable. Each course was presented beautifully and explained thoroughly. I really appreciated the advice on such things as what order to eat each differing bite to get the best progression of flavors. I am an international traveler and have had some incredible meals over the years - but nothing that compared to this meal. I highly recommend making a visit to this restaurant during a stay to Madrid. Set aside one evening to take your time and thoroughly enjoy your evening.  Thank you, Cebo, for making such a memorable evening for us!!

review_preview: Cebo was the second dinner of my three night indulgence (A'barra, Cebo and Ramon Freixa, see all reviews) in Madrid. Each dinner was exceptional in its own way, elegant, beautifully presented and delicious, creative food. Each small bite or dish was exquisite, each meal was...
review_full: Cebo was the second dinner of my three night indulgence (A'barra, Cebo and Ramon Freixa, see all reviews) in Madrid. Each dinner was exceptional in its own way, elegant, beautifully presented and delicious, creative food. Each small bite or dish was exquisite, each meal was substantial and I loved the creativity of each of these chefs. The service at each location was superb, the staff were extremely educated on the dishes and eager to share their knowledge, and extremely attentive to your needs and desires. You left each location feeling pampered. Each location was a special, elegant restaurant where you did not feel out of place in jeans and a nice shirt. Each was artfully decorated, and beautiful in its own right. Note: These dinners allow the chefs to be creative in their art, this is not the place you come to for standard fare. Enjoying this meal includes opening you mind and palate to the possibilities and creativity of each of these artists.  Dinner at each of these restaurants is a decadent treat and I was privileged to be able to do three of these on consecutive nights. Specific to Cebo. Food: I loved the food at Cebo. I thought the food was biased towards the seafood side but loved every dish. The food was bolder in flavor than the other restaurants, but the chef did show his creativity in combining flavors and ingredients. The food was once again beautifully presented and the meal was hearty.  Ambiance: The restaurant is beautiful, I loved the open space dominated by the central chandeliers. The decor is elegant but understated. A beautiful place to spend an evening in a relaxed atmosphere.  Service: Impeccable. The staff was once again attentive and eager to make your meal a dining experience.  We loved dinner here and would highly recommend this restaurant.

review_preview: We came here for a nice dinner to end our trip to Madrid, and boy it did not disappoint us!There were 2 menus which one can close from, one with 10 dishes, the other with 17 dishes (inspired by the 17 regions of Spain)...
review_full: We came here for a nice dinner to end our trip to Madrid, and boy it did not disappoint us! There were 2 menus which one can close from, one with 10 dishes, the other with 17 dishes (inspired by the 17 regions of Spain) , as I went with my mom, so we went with the 10 dishes classical menu. The earliest dinner time was 20:30, I guess this is typical for Spanish people. So when we arrived early at 20:00 (thinking to have a drink at the restaurant before dinner ), the restaurant was not open yet and we had to wait around the hotel for the restaurant to open. The service tonight was impeccable. Ways to best enjoy the dishes were explained, and each dish came with an explosion of flavours and some with different layers of flavours as well. My absolute favourite tonight was the squid dish, the different sauces they used brought out the freshness of the squid.   For wines, they have an extensive wine list and 2 different wine pairings to choose from, the classic one (with all Spanish wines) and the premium one (20 and 40 euros respectively) My mom and I don’t speak any Spanish at all and it was not a problem at this establishment as everyone here speaks good English. The price was also very reasonable for a Michelin 1 star restaurant as we only spend just over 200 euros for the 2 of us (that is with wine pairing) I just heard they will be doing a completely different menu in March! All in all I will recommend this restaurant to anyone coming to Madrid, but definitely remember to book your table early as tonight when we went, it was fully occupied and they don’t have a lot of tables!

review_preview: We booked this place for our Valentine’s dinner and we were just blown away by the outstanding service and unique environment. The service staff is impeccable and made us feel very special and welcome, the wine list is very satisfactory and the menu selection was...
review_full: We booked this place for our Valentine’s dinner and we were just blown away by the outstanding service and unique environment. The service staff is impeccable and made us feel very special and welcome, the wine list is very satisfactory and the menu selection was very well balanced with impressive local Spanish products. We really got the feeling that we were tasting the best that Spain has to offer, and we really appreciated the personal table visit from the manager and sous chef to ensure we were having a good experience. Our personal menu favorites were Black Andalusian Squid, the Costa Brava creamy rice and the chocolate dessert at the end of the menu - what we liked a bit less was the piglet ear that was a bit too chewy, the glazed beef that wasn’t really anything special, and the Sweet bites on top of the cotton candy that really was just a bit weird and bland - but we really enjoyed the churro bread to balance this up. This restaurant is the best we have ever tried in Spain, and with a few adjustments we think it has a good potential to climb even higher in the Spanish gastro rankings. Thank you so much for this exclusive experience and for taking such great care of us!

The excellent evening came to a close with a visit from the chef to ask our opinion of our meal - I could only say "It was excellent!"

review_preview: Had a wonderful meal at Cebo to 'celebrate' (or rather 'soften the blow') of our last night in Madrid. Opted for the "around the entirety of Spain in 17 courses" option which was wonderful and well worth it (it's a course for every region, and...
review_full: Had a wonderful meal at Cebo to 'celebrate' (or rather 'soften the blow') of our last night in Madrid. Opted for the "around the entirety of Spain in 17 courses" option which was wonderful and well worth it (it's a course for every region, and deconstructed a classic dish or flavor profile of that region). Yes it's over the top. But it's a delightful journey. Booking is a bit challenging (to be expected) and you have to plan in advance, especially if you're going during prime tourist season (be prepared to visit the website a month in advance of every day you are thinking you are going to get a table for dinner. Lunch is more open and I'm sure just as wonderful) As a side note - the wine list is surprisingly affordable and the staff was a lot of fun to interact with.

title_review: Hands down our favorite restaurant in Madrid!
review_preview: As soon as we walked into this stunning Michelin star restaurant we were greeted warmly by the maitre, who recognised us even though it had been a year since our first visit. The decor is tasteful and subdued, with plenty of room between tables. We...
review_full: As soon as we walked into this stunning Michelin star restaurant we were greeted warmly by the maitre, who recognised us even though it had been a year since our first visit. The decor is tasteful and subdued, with plenty of room between tables. We opted for chef Aurelio Morales' Classics menu (see photo) and the local wine pairing. Every single dish was delicious, surprising and creative, all plated beautifully. Wines were also top notch, and plentiful. Service was excellent and attentive, with the waitress explaining each dish as well as the best way to eat it, and the sommelier giving us information about the wines. During the meal we conversed with the maitre and happened to mention we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. We were stunned to be given extra dishes as well as a lovely lemon cake and champagne at the end of our meal. It was a faultless and unforgettable evening, one we'll always treasure. We won’t be surprised if the restaurant receives a second Michelin star before our next visit.

review_preview: After 10 days in Spain, we were a bit sick of the whole tapas thing and decided on Italian.  This place had a decent rating and was within walking distance from our hotel. It's located in a nice sort of "hipster" neighborhood.  The menu consists...
review_full: After 10 days in Spain, we were a bit sick of the whole tapas thing and decided on Italian. This place had a decent rating and was within walking distance from our hotel. It's located in a nice sort of "hipster" neighborhood. The menu consists of pizzas, pastas, salads and appetizers that feature their fresh house-made mozzarella. We decided to go with a mozzarella appetizer, a pizza and a pasta. All three were very tasty!!! The pasta dishes are baked in the pizza oven and come out nice and crispy on the edges. The pizza has an incredible crust. They give you red pepper infused olive oil which is fantastic on both the pizza and pasta. Prices are reasonable and service was fine. Very nice diversion from tapas for one night!!

title_review: Fun Food in a Fun Place
review_preview: Don't miss this spot if you're in the neighborhood.  The food is mostly tapas but with a twist from the traditional.  We had croquettes and a pork on the grill.  They were fantastic.  The highlight of the meal was the burrata which is infused with...
review_full: Don't miss this spot if you're in the neighborhood. The food is mostly tapas but with a twist from the traditional. We had croquettes and a pork on the grill. They were fantastic. The highlight of the meal was the burrata which is infused with basil oil at the table. No exaggeration, we scraped the plate clean. The wine list is very nice. Both red and white wine is available by both bottle and glass. The atmosphere is trendy and exciting and our service was spectacular. We ate early, so tables were available, but the restaurant was getting busy when we left. Certainly worth an early arrival to avoid a wait.

review_preview: We didn't have a reservation & it was at least an hour wait so we decided to sit at the bar!It was a Fabulous dinner and SO reasonably priced. Our waiter Marjuan, suggested dishes as well as his favorites and he was right on!...
review_full: We didn't have a reservation & it was at least an hour wait so we decided to sit at the bar! It was a Fabulous dinner and SO reasonably priced. Our waiter Marjuan, suggested dishes as well as his favorites and he was right on! It was amazing to partially view the kitchen & it was the best tapas to date. We watched them make the most delicious Sangria! The croquettas, a large tasty tomato with a parmesan sauce, a unique ball of Burrata which was infused with pesto sauce were excellent. review_preview: I know I'm in Madrid and I'm supposed to be eating traditional Spanish fare. But I've been in Spain about 2 weeks and I'm missing home. This place is literally across the street from my hotel. I had to try it. I e already had...
review_full: I know I'm in Madrid and I'm supposed to be eating traditional Spanish fare. But I've been in Spain about 2 weeks and I'm missing home. This place is literally across the street from my hotel. I had to try it. I e already had 2 burgers here in Spain and I was underwhelmed to say the least. Fortunately for me, third time's charm. We walked in and were instantly greeted by Bryan and shown to our seat. The place has an upscale feel but it's really not. Very casual in fact. Comfortable open floor plan. They give you the option to customize your burger which is nice. I got a the wings, vanilla shake, a burger and fries. The wings stay crispy since the sauce is on the side. They have four sizes to choose from for burgers. The second option was a big healthy burger. I was shocked that my burger was ordered medium rare and actually came out just that way. A true mid rare at that. I'm actually going back tomorrow to have another before leaving Madrid. The fries weren't the best. But my burger was tasty and cooked right. Nice job! See you soon. Go treat yourself. And it's really not bad pricewise at all. Especially considering the neighborhood

title_review: Two day tapas here, consistency with quality
review_preview: First day, started with sangria, chicken, tortilla, and "don" bao. Chicken cooked perfectly, tortilla with lovely truffle oil, and the bak with spice "kick".Second day, started with tintonde verrano, then with veal, "cloth hanged" bacon with apple bread, cheese and bacon, and huevos. Veal...
review_full: First day, started with sangria, chicken, tortilla, and "don" bao. Chicken cooked perfectly, tortilla with lovely truffle oil, and the bak with spice "kick". Second day, started with tintonde verrano, then with veal, "cloth hanged" bacon with apple bread, cheese and bacon, and huevos. Veal with hearty juice, bacon, cheese and apple cannot go wrong with a "torch show" to get that bacon going. Huevos with their style was also superb. Food is great, but the service was better! The barman Santiago was highly attentive, suggesting waiting people to sit around at the bar to comfort them. And of course, I received good services from him despite it wad a super busy days. Muchas Gracias! Sadly I was alone, so I could not order seafood paella, which was flying out from kitchen so many times. Really worth a visit here to see some tapas with contemporary cooking!

review_preview: We recently had dinner here.  We were taken care of by the owner who treated us like family.  This is his second location and we were surprised to hear that it had only been open for three weeks since it was running like clockwork.  The...
review_full: We recently had dinner here. We were taken care of by the owner who treated us like family. This is his second location and we were surprised to hear that it had only been open for three weeks since it was running like clockwork. The menu is the same as his other location. The food is homemade and absolutely wonderful! We ordered several dishes and shared them family style. Everything was delicious and good serving sizes. When we were finished, there were still more dishes we wanted to try so we ordered a few more and left completely stuffed! Don't forget to order a pitcher or two of sangaria while you are there. It is incredible as well. Do yourself a favor and visit this restaurant for a delicious meal in Madrid.

title_review: So good I went back again
review_preview: Tucked away not far from the Plaza Mayor, this restaurant is well worth hunting out. The staff are friendly and helpful, the place is attractively laid out and the food is tremendous. So good in fact that I decided to go back there for my...
review_full: Tucked away not far from the Plaza Mayor, this restaurant is well worth hunting out. The staff are friendly and helpful, the place is attractively laid out and the food is tremendous. So good in fact that I decided to go back there for my final meal before returning to the UK. The cooking is creative and wonderfully tasty. The burrata injected with basil was great but I really enjoyed Don Ramon's Eggs which were two fried eggs over potato and topped with iberico ham. Hugely satisfying but really quite simple. Good wine too, highly recommended.

You can choose from either Beef or Ox for your Burger, also you can pick from "Shy" (160g) to "Daring" (500g) My wife had a Moderate Steakburger (250g), I opted for a "Brave" (350g) Ox Jackburger, both arrived well presented and my burger (1st time having Ox) was cooked just right and very tasty. review_full: We dined here early, about 8:30, on a Saturday night but the place was already getting busy. It's not a very large restaurant so there is limited table space. At least a couple of the waitstaff spoke English and they provided an English version menu which was helpful. We had a pitcher of sangria which was very tasty though a bit on the weak side. The chicken curry was excellent as were several of the other dishes we ordered. It seems like we were being waited on by different person every time a dish was brought which led to some confusion over the orders. The restaurant was very busy but some consistency in who was handling our table would have helped. All in all a very good meal at a decent price.

review_preview: For 80 € you get an excellent and fascinating tasting menu that comprises 15 courses. They combine "mountain and sea" as a reflection of Spanish cuisine and thus there are a variety of seafood and meat dishes. Tastes are strong and textures varying. Some tastes...
review_full: For 80 € you get an excellent and fascinating tasting menu that comprises 15 courses. They combine "mountain and sea" as a reflection of Spanish cuisine and thus there are a variety of seafood and meat dishes. Tastes are strong and textures varying. Some tastes can be even a bit challenging, but in a good way: if one is tasting through foreing cuisine, there ought to be surprises. In particular the boqueron dish was strong, and for some reason I still keep craving for the marinated variety of the fish. Additional highlight was the surprise dish of asparagus and snapper. Last but not the least, all the courses were extremely beautiful. As for the wines, the more expensive pairing of 40€ was definitely worth the price. In particular the white wine was excellent. Also the pairing with boqueron was perfect. Waiters were keen to keep our glasses full. The waiter who took our wine order has all the reasons to recommend the more expensive package (although surely the less expensive one is also good). Service was top-notch, from entering the restaurant to leaving the place. Courteous, but still easy-going. Also the fact that the chef came for a short visit gave a solid impression that the place truly appreciates its patrons.

review_preview: Having read many of the rave reviews of the 16 course expressions tasting menu and wine pairing we decided to go for that despite fact that it seemed excessive: It was a holiday dinner and we planned to splurge. Everything was prepared and served with...
review_full: Having read many of the rave reviews of the 16 course expressions tasting menu and wine pairing we decided to go for that despite fact that it seemed excessive: It was a holiday dinner and we planned to splurge. Everything was prepared and served with great care, skill, and expertise. In the end the meal was impressive but a bit overwhelming—the anchovy dish and aged raw beef dishes were beautifully prepared but unappealing after having so many other courses. The wine pairings were excellent and generously poured. In the end, we wish we had gone for the less expansive 5 course tasting menu—which appeared on the menu but was never explained or featured as we left feeling impressed by the food and service but a bit weighted down after consuming so much of so many things. Overall an amazing meal but giving people less excessive/ more moderate options might be wise.

review_preview: My wife and I enjoy our fine dining as we travel the globe and there is no doubt that Cebo is in the very top echelon of world restaurants, and truly deserving of its Michelin star. For our lunch, we accepted the maître d’s recommendation...
review_full: My wife and I enjoy our fine dining as we travel the globe and there is no doubt that Cebo is in the very top echelon of world restaurants, and truly deserving of its Michelin star. For our lunch, we accepted the maître d’s recommendation for the classic 10 course and accompanying wines and boy are we glad we did…. Absolutely superb from start to finish. Faultless food, wine and service. Perhaps the ‘baby piglet ear’ was a fraction chewy and the ‘cheese pistachio’ a tiny too salty but I’m being very, very fussy. The ‘anchovy’ was gorgeous while the ‘costa brava creamy rice’, a lovely innovation, was to die for! They even provided 2 additional complementary surprise courses which were mouth-watering. Absolutely no pretentions from the staff that you often encounter in such establishments with Bianca, our smiling lead hostess, charming and helpful.  Congratulations to the chef and the maitre’d… they deserve all the pundits they receive…Get there before the chef gets his 2nd star and prices rise accordingly! We cursed as we left that we had left our reservation to the last days of our 3-week stay in Madrid and couldn’t return to try the 17-course extravaganza for a dinner.

review_preview: There is a chance that very soon this restaurant gets on Michelin star, and you need to pay much more for the tasting menu. So book a table already!Fantastic fine-dining evening. Great balance and rhythm between the plates. The total amount of food spot...
review_full: There is a chance that very soon this restaurant gets on Michelin star, and you need to pay much more for the tasting menu. So book a table already! Fantastic fine-dining evening. Great balance and rhythm between the plates. The total amount of food spot on. Top notch service as you can expect from a restaurant looking for that first star :) The place looks extremely cool, and for once there's plenty of space on the table. There's only one dish the chef has kept in the tasting menu since the beginning. Boquerón (2016) is good and interesting, but it felt more like an artistic break between the superb tasting surprises coming non-stop. At the end of the event, it was a great pleasure to meet the chef himself. He has the attitude set right. That reflects to everything in the restaurant. Are they going to get the first Michelin star? My bet is not yet this year, but next year with some fine tuning, yes they will get that star. The Rueda wine they have selected, was one of the best I have ever tried!

review_preview: CEBO is a real find. In the heart of a bustling city it is an oasis of charm, impeccable and friendly service and amazing food that is cooked and presented creatively. We ate at 2:30 pm which gave us time to enjoy their complete 15...
review_full: CEBO is a real find. In the heart of a bustling city it is an oasis of charm, impeccable and friendly service and amazing food that is cooked and presented creatively. We ate at 2:30 pm which gave us time to enjoy their complete 15 course “expression menu”. The combination of properly proportioned and different textures and tastes was perfectly done and we tried dishes that were wonderful but which we would never thought to order - particularly memorable were the black chicken and razor clams and the callos. Our server explained each dish as served and her English very good. This restaurant ranks among the top 5 we have experienced in the world and was surprisingly affordable for the glorious food and attentive care provided. It was perfect.

title_review: Fantastic meal...one of our best during trip to Spain
review_preview: We knew we needed a break from typical Spanish food so we chose Oven, what we didn't expect was one of our best meals of our trip. The flavors were simple yet vibrant. Burrata appetizers were delicious, pizzas were on point and the Bologna tagliatelle...
review_full: We knew we needed a break from typical Spanish food so we chose Oven, what we didn't expect was one of our best meals of our trip. The flavors were simple yet vibrant. Burrata appetizers were delicious, pizzas were on point and the Bologna tagliatelle was devoured by all. Rodrigo was a true professional and Belen was delightful. We felt very cared for as opposed to traditional Spanish service where they leave it up to you to let you know what you need - which is fine too, but at the end of our trip we were earth and worn so it felt great to have them guiding the ship. We had a lovely evening, a perfect last night to our family adventure in Spain, thank you Rodrigo, Belen and Oven!!

I was lucky to stumble upon this place when my other choice was closed. Great luck. Go!
