Of course one would expect this from a Michelin* place, but there were still details that stood out:- the competence and friendlyness of the staff (a special mention to Bianca)- the menue takes up dishes from Spain that are based on unusual (for an expensive place) ingredients such as pigs ears and slow roasted meat. The flavors were just great- we could not believe that for 20 Euro one gets excellent wines (this is usually the price we pay for 1 glas in our own countriy)- we appreciated the speed at which the dishes were served, not hurried, but also not spaced to far apart.- the atmosphere was at the same time elegant and relaxed.Thanks to the whole team - we will come back and try the 17 course menue :-)

review_preview: My wife and I enjoyed every minute of our meal at CEBO. The staff was warm and helpful from the moment we walked into the place. They seated us in front of the open chef’s working area so we could see them prepare the dishes....
review_full: My wife and I enjoyed every minute of our meal at CEBO. The staff was warm and helpful from the moment we walked into the place. They seated us in front of the open chef’s working area so we could see them prepare the dishes. Those guys are artists. Everyone spoke English well, and explained everything put in front of us. We did the smaller fixed menu for 80E and it was PLENTY of food. The waitress said not to get the bigger one unless we were really hungry. They offer two wine pairings, the “Classic” for a very reasonable 20E a person and a “Premium” for I think 40 or 50E. We chose the Classic because it included Spanish wines. All the wines were delicious (we particularly loved the white Rioja) and they were very generous with their refills, good thing we took an Uber back to our hotel. We started with a nice Cava, then the white Rioja, followed by a fine Ribera del Duero, and finally a Moscato with dessert. The food was a very modern top chef type of deal, with multiple morsels with interesting ingredients and imaginative constructions, hard to describe but trust me, yummy! Many of the dishes came with helpful eating instructions from our waitress, like “eat this first, then that, use your fingers for this,” etc. When I stood up mid-meal to check out the facilities our waitress came over and asked if we were celebrating anything that evening. Well, a big anniversary is coming up, so after dessert came an extra “special” dessert. All absolutely delicious. We were bursting. We spent about 2 1/2 hours there. The whole bill came to 208E, plus tip. I think it’s a great value for the kind of experience you have there. Would definitely return on our next trip to Madrid.

review_preview: We stumbled in here last night- despite having another Italian restaurant in mind! And we were glad we did! We have found the service in Madrid in general to be very lacklustre and unfriendly. It takes ages to get a menu, ages to order and...
review_full: We stumbled in here last night- despite having another Italian restaurant in mind! And we were glad we did!  We have found the service in Madrid in general to be very lacklustre and unfriendly. It takes ages to get a menu, ages to order and ages to get your bill, ages to pay. It's quite irritating actually! However this was not the case in this restaurant, which was a breath of fresh air. The service was attentive from the moment we sat down and throughout! Nothing was too much for the waiters. Service with a smile, they were all so pleasant- but Carlos in particular was so helpful. Would highly recommend!  We only hope we find a few more restaurants with the same level of customer service before we go back to Ireland! If not, we shall be back! Thanks again!

review_preview: This is the best restaurant we've ever visited! From the moment we walked in we were made to feel special by the staff who were all superb. The service is attentive but really natural and not at all stuffy or pretentious so you are made...
review_full: This is the best restaurant we've ever visited! From the moment we walked in we were made to feel special by the staff who were all superb.  The service is attentive but really natural and not at all stuffy or pretentious so you are made to feel really relaxed.  The maitre'd explained the philosophy of the restaurant (to showcase local ingredients from the mountains and the sea) and discussed the menu options. We selected a la carte but when we had made our choices our waiter suggested that we could split each dish between us so we effectively ended up with four courses rather than two. We also received 3 complimentary dishes which were all of exquisite quality, featuring unusual ingredients such as sea urchins. All in all a fantastic experience and delivered at a surprisingly reasonable price. We had beers, champagne and wine to accompany the food and the final bill was only €140. We mistakenly thought that the iva was a service charge rather than a tax so shamefully did not leave a tip so hopefully this review will make up for that!

review_preview: My husband reserved a table as a surprise for my birthday and it did not disappoint; the staff were friendly, accommodating and went the extra mile to make my birthday special.We had the 17 menu, the flavours, textures and presentation were all so different...
review_full: My husband reserved a table as a surprise for my birthday and it did not disappoint; the staff were friendly, accommodating and went the extra mile to make my birthday special. We had the 17 menu, the flavours, textures and presentation were all so different - each course was a surprise. Both the savoury and sweet courses were just as delicious and in beautiful classic surroundings. We have been to Michelin star and recommended restaurants before where the food either follow a theme or is predictable, or the team can be pretentious creating a cold, unwelcoming atmosphere. CEBO did none of these things, we would definitely return and recommend a visit, and it certainly created an experience we will not forget - thank you.

review_preview: We had dinner here one night while we stayed at the Urban Hotel and were very impressed.  As tempting as the larger tasting menu seemed, we chose the smaller of the two as we were just too full from all the great food we had...
review_full: We had dinner here one night while we stayed at the Urban Hotel and were very impressed. As tempting as the larger tasting menu seemed, we chose the smaller of the two as we were just too full from all the great food we had been eating in Madrid. But we were very impressed in any case. The food was delicious and very artfully presented. We also enjoyed the wine pairing and of course the service was flawless and the ambiance elegant without being overly formal. On top of all of this, it is an incredible value. We ate at four Michelin starred restaurants on our trip and Cebo was about half price of some of them and offered a similar dining experience. Cebo should be on any foodies must do list while in Madrid.

review_preview: I can’t recommend this restaurant enough, a must visit for lunch or dinner while in Madrid. The restaurant was stunning and beautifully set up. We chose the chef’s tasting menu called ‘seventeen’ (€95) with 14 courses and  3 dessert items with wine pairing (€25). Pros:...
review_full: I can’t recommend this restaurant enough, a must visit for lunch or dinner while in Madrid. The restaurant was stunning and beautifully set up. We chose the chef’s tasting menu called ‘seventeen’ (€95) with 14 courses and 3 dessert items with wine pairing (€25).  Pros: The seventeen menu items was created by chef Aurelio Morales who was rewarded with 1 Michelin Star this year 2018 - The food journey was amazing, the creation of each dish was designed to represented each region around Spain. Aurelio came out to the dining area towards the end of our lunch to meet us, which ended our lunch on a high. Overall service was exceptional.  Cons: None.  TIP: You can reserve a table online which makes it easy for tourists.

review_full: After some superb high end meals in Barcelona, we arrived in Madrid with great expectations given the excellent reviews of Cebo. The deep fried piglet ear was especially unpleasant. The raw anchovy was also not particularly likable, and both the creamy rice and cheese pistachio had no taste. It is difficult to understand why a restaurant with such a menu would be awarded a Michelin star. We had better experiences at local tapas bars for under 30 Euro.

title_review: Amazing Meal In A Romantic Setting.
review_preview: We visited Madrid for my birthday in July and after checking out fine dining options in the city we booked for 2 at Cebo. We found the restaurant very easily as it was one of the main roads in the city. The room is very...
review_full: We visited Madrid for my birthday in July and after checking out fine dining options in the city we booked for 2 at Cebo. We found the restaurant very easily as it was one of the main roads in the city. The room is very simple and elegant and front of house staff very polite and courteous with a very good knowledge about the food and wine. We booked the Classic Menu which was 80 euros but was treated to few extra dishes from the extended menu as a gift from the restaurant which was a very welcome surprise. Each dish was explained and suggested how was the best way to experience each dish. We had 11 courses in total and with wine our bill was 185 Euros. Its nice to see many bottles of wine around the 20 euro mark in a Michelin Starred establishment, so you don't feel that they are trying to squeeze more money out of you as a customer. Excellent service, Amazing food and very well priced for the quality. I would highly recommend.

title_review: Great food in a lively atmosphere at affordable prices; start the night here.
review_preview: During a recent five night stay in Madrid we found our way to Taberna Mas Al Sur, having noted it’s high ranking on TripAdvisor during our pre-trip homework.Throughout our trip’s dining experiences, this was probably our most ‘casual’ meal and environment, but easily one...
review_full: During a recent five night stay in Madrid we found our way to Taberna Mas Al Sur, having noted it’s high ranking on TripAdvisor during our pre-trip homework. Throughout our trip’s dining experiences, this was probably our most ‘casual’ meal and environment, but easily one of our more enjoyable nights. The setting is modern, the staff are young and eager but, most importantly, attentive, knowledgeable and with an excellent grasp of English. The service was quick, the atmosphere was alive and the tapas was fantastic. As with similar eateries, the option to order half portions was pounced upon and all (several) dishes proved excellent. Also, the drink sizes (spirits) are extremely generous! All-in-all, Taberna Mas El Sur offered informal, centrally-located dining with excellent food and a lively atmosphere at an extremely affordable price. If you were to spend more time in Madrid this could easily become ‘the local’.

Food was excellent and simple. The octopus salad is great with lightly grilled octopus and lots of veggies (a rarity in most Madrid restaurants), but the star was the braised flank steak. The depth of flavor was unbelievable. If you are a fan of Tinga, this is for you. Dessert was good too, had carrot cake which was fresh and homemade.

title_review: Good food ruined by bad service
review_preview: After reading good reviews on Trip Advisor, we were really looking forward to the meal. We were a party of 4 and had reservations. We were seated right the way and immediately given the menus.  Our table was sort of in the middle of the...
review_full: After reading good reviews on Trip Advisor, we were really looking forward to the meal. We were a party of 4 and had reservations. We were seated right the way and immediately given the menus. Our table was sort of in the middle of the room and the waiters constantly ran by us. I am not sure why the waiters had to move that fast, but it created very uncomfortable feeling as if we were in a train station and not in a restaurant. We ordered 6 tapas, bread basket and drinks. The bread basket came immediately but was almost thrown on the table by the running waiter. The 2 tapas came immediately after. The 3rd tapa came, the small table started to get very crowded, plated had to be moved around to be able to fit the drinks that arrived. Unfortunately that did not stop the running waiter from bringing the rest of the food. Within 5-7 minutes we were served all 6 tapas and the plates were piled up literally one on top of the other on our table. That combined with the running-by waiters created not so relaxing environment. We were out in 30 minutes. The evening was ruined.

review_preview: Stylish, modern restaurant with extremely knowledgeable staff offering first-rate service. There were 2 tasting menus to choose between: one with 10 courses focused more on typical dishes from Madrid and the other a gastronomic tour of Spain offering 17 courses.  We opted for the former...
review_full: Stylish, modern restaurant with extremely knowledgeable staff offering first-rate service. There were 2 tasting menus to choose between: one with 10 courses focused more on typical dishes from Madrid and the other a gastronomic tour of Spain offering 17 courses. We opted for the former and were rather glad we did for although the portions are not huge (thankfully), they were packed with flavour and very rich - delicious goes without saying - and felt more would have been challenging! Both menus necessarily involve quite a lot of intervention from the staff as they present each dish and we felt 10 was more than enough to strike a good balance between the theatre of fine dining and conversation! Excellent wine choices and the chef came round and addressed each table - best of luck to him: a well-deserved Michelin star! Food with wine/Pedro Ximenez x 2 total bill 180 euros which we felt was good value for such fine quality. Highly recommended!

title_review: Anniversary Dinner, we will return again
review_preview: We shared our anniversary dinner with the 17 course tasting trip through Spain’s regions with the paired wine. First the service, from reception to la cuenta was fantastic. I would expect this from any 1*+ restaurant but sadly we have experienced lower quality treatment at...
review_full: We shared our anniversary dinner with the 17 course tasting trip through Spain’s regions with the paired wine. First the service, from reception to la cuenta was fantastic. I would expect this from any 1*+ restaurant but sadly we have experienced lower quality treatment at other restaurants in Spain.  The setting is open but somewhat intimate, certain tables get a view of final preparations of courses coming out of the kitchen - which can be a nice touch for those that are into that. All courses were presented beautifully and fully explained. My wife and I posed a few curious questions and our server enthusiastically answered all of them, even darting back to the kitchen to explain some ingredients and inspirations. Knowledge of the wines and pairings was strong and offered freely. As a foodie, I appreciate these additional touches as opposed to just having a plate put in front of me. The reservation process was simple, and confirmed in the days leading up to our date. Overall value was strong for a newer 1* in Madrid. You can get a great meal for <€25 a person in Madrid. You are going to places like Cebo for the artistry, thoughtful and precise menu construction and world class service. On these marks, we highly recommend Cebo for special occasions and I will not hesitate to rebook to experience the menu again as it changes.

title_review: A dinner at the BAR of the restaurant CEBO, not in the restaurant. Quite good
review_preview: This restaurant has the unfortunate feature to allow only reservations by internet, which is highly unpleasant: human beings prefer to talk to human beings. A phone call led to nothing as I did not wish to be recalled, being fully busy in Madrid in a...
review_full: This restaurant has the unfortunate feature to allow only reservations by internet, which is highly unpleasant: human beings prefer to talk to human beings. A phone call led to nothing as I did not wish to be recalled, being fully busy in Madrid in a conference. I thought that I could still book a table by arriving at 8 p.m. Alas I was told that the full restaurant was full from opening time which is 8.30 p.m. I am a fast eater and promised, to no avail, that if allowed to enter at 8.30 p.m. I would leave at 9 p.m. In despair my only solution was to eat at the BAR of the CEBO. This was quite good and very pleasant. Service was amiable and food was very good. They took my order at 8.20 p.m. while they normally open at 8.30 p.m. and I was out by 9.03 p.m.: I intended to try something else in Madrid that I won't mention in this report. The dinner without a starter costed with water and no wine circa 30 euros. The place is small and hopefully it will not be invaded by readers of this report as I wish to go there once more when I return to Madrid. The only trouble is that they had a credit card problem and to make life simpler I paid by cash.

title_review: Great location, great staff, great food, great bar!
review_preview: Inclan Bar was recommended by a friend of mine who is a native of Madrid. My wife and I moved to Madrid a few months ago and this has quickly become one of our favourite places. The staff are friendly and attentive, especially the bar...
review_full: Inclan Bar was recommended by a friend of mine who is a native of Madrid. My wife and I moved to Madrid a few months ago and this has quickly become one of our favourite places. The staff are friendly and attentive, especially the bar staff who stay calm and efficient even when the restaurants is really busy, and the food is excellent. I also loved the spicy pork bao, with the spicy sauce, and although it is indeed busy, we reserved a table earlier in the evening for 10pm without any trouble. I enjoyed it!! The lighting was good, the food was served quickly, and the menu has a large variety of Spanish/European/fusion food. The cocktails also looked spectacular! And the prices aren't bad. Try it!

title_review: VERY GOOD FOOD AND FRIENDLY WELL SPEAKING ENGLISH WAITERS
review_preview: Last night (21-07-2019) we had a lovely meal at this bar. The food is delicious and well served. Our waiter (Nico) and the other waiters at the restaurant spoke very good English and gave us tips about what kind of food and the exact amount...
review_full: Last night (21-07-2019) we had a lovely meal at this bar. The food is delicious and well served. Our waiter (Nico) and the other waiters at the restaurant spoke very good English and gave us tips about what kind of food and the exact amount of food to choose. We had the croquettes, spicy potatoes, risotto with mushrooms, some kind of cheese with basil and the veal with veggies. All of it was SO DELICIOUS!!! We believe it is the best restaurant to eat when you want to eat for a reasonal price. For the food, 2 desserts and a jar of sangria we paid 61 euros. When we go back to Madrid someday we would absolutely go eat again at that place!  I am a frequent traveler and travel all over the world so I have seen a lot of places. Also I work in a restaurant myself, so I know what to say about quality.  Thanks a lot for the great evening!

review_preview: This is a laid back tapas place with a nice vibe and and a -very- ambitious kitchen, the food is honestly in a higher category than what you pay. We were very impressed by the food (the edible cigars are a particular treat as well...
review_full: This is a laid back tapas place with a nice vibe and and a -very- ambitious kitchen, the food is honestly in a higher category than what you pay. We were very impressed by the food (the edible cigars are a particular treat as well as the “this is not a tomato” tapas) and the cocktails. Ruben and colleagues makes excellent craft cocktails and also improvised some drinks for us just for fun! Service and atmosphere is second to none and what you would expect from a much more expensive restaurant. Very fast service, and a big thank you to Francesco for taking such good care of us.  We ended up going back 2 times more during our short stay in Madrid. We will be back again for sure next time in Madrid!  Go. Eat. Drink. You will not be disappointed!  /Erik and Elin

title_review: Great Food, Fantastic Presentation, Excellent Service
review_preview: Eat here if you can. The food is amazing; the sauces are all wonderful and match their partners wonderfully. The chef is highly creative and each dish is brought presented artfully and interestingly. The octopus was magnificent, the Iberian pork with sweet potato chips had...
review_full: Eat here if you can. The food is amazing; the sauces are all wonderful and match their partners wonderfully. The chef is highly creative and each dish is brought presented artfully and interestingly. The octopus was magnificent, the Iberian pork with sweet potato chips had a superb goat cheese sauce and and apple "sauce" heavy with cinnamon that worked wonderfully and makes my mouth water as I type. Every dish we had was a winner. The service was just right. Our server, Robert, did a great job and (in case you are wondering) the staff spoke English quite well (luckily, as my Spanish is sadly inept...). We were lucky to have gotten a table. I would suggest a reservation, either calling or stopping by early to make one in person. You will not regret your experience here. Probably our best dining experience in our quick trip to Madrid and Barcelona.

review_full: We had one of the best meals for lunch since we have been in Spain for the last 3 weeks eating tapas from Barcelona, San Sebastián and Seville. We are just finding our way to trying some great restaurants. Everything we had were so tasty that we said "wow!" after each dish we tried. My husband had the menu del dia and his salad with grilled chicken, cheese, caramelized onions, grapes and walnuts with balsamic dressing was very good. My fried shrimp in garlic and peppers were so tasty, my husband mopped up all the sauce with bread. You have to love garlic as there were maybe a dozen slices of garlic in he dish. The ribs were tender and potatoes were sliced thinly with a mandolin in a type of gratin. He got dessert with his meal and had the beet cake which we thought unusual but it was light and a good ending to the meal. But wait, we also got two after dinner shooters of something similar to Baileys when we asked for the check. It was just a lovely lunch with great food and such pleasant staff which adds to the entire experience. We hope to eat there again before we leave.

Seasoning is heavy but within the bounds of edible / perfect. Exceptional wine list and plenty of value if you follow the direction of the excellent sommelier. An a la carte offering would be welcome but until then I strongly recommend the 10 course menu rather than the gargantuan 17 plate epic. Enjoy!

review_preview: Alas, I've titled my review in jest -- Mas Al Sur is a bit off the beaten path for tourists, and as a part-time resident of Madrid, I loathe seconding the glowing reviews already here fearing it will only lead to making tables harder to...
review_full: Alas, I've titled my review in jest -- Mas Al Sur is a bit off the beaten path for tourists, and as a part-time resident of Madrid, I loathe seconding the glowing reviews already here fearing it will only lead to making tables harder to get, etc. and hey, would love to keep this place a secret for myself and friends. But it is that good, particularly when you measure it by value -- actually, by that measure it's astonishing. We've eaten here now 3X, and i can't find fault -- any fault -- with it. Perhaps the ambience is a bit casual, but comfortable, modern. I do prefer the setting at Mas al Sur compared to its sister restaurant El Sur. Try everything, anything - you won't be disappointed.

title_review: Delicious modern take on Spanish tapas, and really good service!
review_preview: I'd say this restaurant is a must if you want to try a creative take on traditional Spanish food. There are of course some delicious Spanish tapas, such as Brutal's take on Patatas Bravas, croquetas and queso, but also very delicious steak, chicken and paella...
review_full: I'd say this restaurant is a must if you want to try a creative take on traditional Spanish food. There are of course some delicious Spanish tapas, such as Brutal's take on Patatas Bravas, croquetas and queso, but also very delicious steak, chicken and paella comparable to Valencia (in my opinion). We also ordered a cheese dish that was sort of like a ball of mozzarella that the waiter then proceeds to stuff with pesto sauce with a syringe. The service is also very good. We arrived for our reservation a bit early and were seated at the bar and given one small beer each to start. Our waiter was Alex, who was incredibly entertaining and helpful. He made us laugh and spent a lot of time with our table. While the food and atmosphere of Brutal is great (especially at the price point), I'd say the staff and service really take the restaurant another step up.

title_review: Great Tapas and Sangria, usually good service
review_preview: I've been there many times and it always a pleasure to eat there, the food is really great and you won't regret it. If you are going as a group (4 or more people) it usually cost between 10-15euros. Last week I had lunch there...
review_full: I've been there many times and it always a pleasure to eat there, the food is really great and you won't regret it. If you are going as a group (4 or more people) it usually cost between 10-15euros. Last week I had lunch there (group of 8) and the waiter Alejandro was really nice and amazing.  It is better to have lunch there because they are less busy than night which can lead to some disagreement as the waiters will pressure you to finish on time. Once, we were having diner there as a group and as we were ordering again they told us that they were waiting for another group in 40 minutes which was ok for us but while they were pressuring us it took them 35 minutes to bring two cocktails ... Also, the solomillo was a bit too raw. At the end they offer us a little shot that we never had because we did not want to bother them and walk towards the bar to have the shot but decided to leave because it was too long.   Conclusion: we prefer going for lunch where the team is better than at night.

title_review: Theater of Fine Dining - with you in the main role
review_preview: If you enjoy the “theater” of fine dining, you will enjoy CEBO. You have the open kitchen where chefs are doing the final preparations, you have the chef strolling the dining room and all the of the other mechanics of fine dining. It's a spectacle...
review_full: If you enjoy the “theater” of fine dining, you will enjoy CEBO. You have the open kitchen where chefs are doing the final preparations, you have the chef strolling the dining room and all the of the other mechanics of fine dining. It's a spectacle and I enjoy it.  And it's not like the theater is masking poor food and wine. Both are just as excellent. Apparently the chef has a lineage to El Bulli and it shows with all of the various texturas you encounter, but despite the gimmicks it's still about the essence of the flavor. Who would have thought that an anchovies ice cream presents you with the most pure essence of anchovies that I have ever tasted or that a dessert based on asparagus, artichoke and red pepper is the one of the best (sweet) desserts, that I have ever tasted. Outstanding.

Cocktails were delicious and served with a twist, food was delicious, my friend had the steak and it was served sizzling on a hot slate to which was carved by staff at the table and she could cook further to her liking, I had a version of a mozzarella and tomato salad, which was presented with a syringe full of pesto that was injected into the fresh mozzarella. I have to say this place is such an exciting dining experience not over the top, but very unique from drinks to food and fabulous service, it’s a must visit and very reasonably priced too.

review_preview: The demarcation between Michelin aspirants and real restaurants is becoming more and more marked, but the two things that the food should share are good flavour and technique, sadly, with Cebo, they fell down on both counts.We chose the Classic menu, since it was...
review_full: The demarcation between Michelin aspirants and real restaurants is becoming more and more marked, but the two things that the food should share are good flavour and technique, sadly, with Cebo, they fell down on both counts. We chose the Classic menu, since it was lunchtime, and the Degustation of 17 courses would have taken us through to re-opening time ! All around there were a myriad of chefs and serving staff, all dressed elegantly in black and with an attention to detail that would have benefited the average operating theatre, so far, so Michelin ! The first two courses ( baby onion and callos) were a work of precision : although, ignoring the way they were plated, both came in the form of a pretty, round, croquette, meant to 'explode in your mouth', perhaps it might have been better to distance these two offerings on the menu ? They weren't, either of them unpleasant,, but you wouldn't come back to Madrid for them, either. The pig's ear should have been deliciously crunchy, like Torreznos, but bits of it were undercooked and so chewy that you couldn't get rid of it.Then came the real punch-line, the anchovies: anchovy ice-cream served on a plate of broth, so that you incorporate the ice-cream into the broth. One mouthful and three of the four of us exploded in disgust. It tasted just like a mouthful of cod liver oil ( Our Belgian friend said that it was like whale oil, same difference) Not only was it disgusting, but it taints the palate for every subsequent course. At the very least a passion fruit sorbet straight afterwards would have helped. The cow was OK: a bit like pulled pork after being cooked for so long, and the truffled cheese bombe, disappointing. At this point in the meal you would have given anything for a plain slice of Manchego Anejo cheese: one was just so sick of everything being 'de and re-constructed' Not an experience one would repeat, but the staff were immaculate, and our table manager, Bianca, in particular, turned the experience into a pleasant, memorable one

We only had time for the 10 course menu but it was served without fuss by attentive but discreet staff, and we left very satisfied and indulged. Special thanks to the Door staff who whisked away our cycles and our scruffy car without batting an eyelid.

review_preview: I 'tried' to have dinner here tonight. Based on reading TripAdvisor reviews I thought I was in for a treat, far from it. My food experience was abysmal. I'm traveling alone and tried to order paella. It turns out they only serve it to 2...
review_full: I 'tried' to have dinner here tonight. Based on reading TripAdvisor reviews I thought I was in for a treat, far from it. My food experience was abysmal. I'm traveling alone and tried to order paella. It turns out they only serve it to 2 or more people. How bizarre? It's already hard enough going to dinner alone, why make it harder on people? So I stuck with getting a tapa order of burrata. Wow was it bad. I could barely stomach a couple of bites before giving up on it. What a waste of 9 euro. I've had burrata before so I have other experiences to compare it to. Their burrata's texture was off. Then it was injected with flavoring (which is a cool concept) but the pesto like injection was so salty it was like spooning salt into my mouth. The burrata came with 3 tomatoes which were very sour and arugula that was far past fresh, it was all wilted. The wait staff was pleasant. I asked for my check quickly having barely eaten any of the burrata. They asked if I didn't like it. I was polite, but honest in my response that, "no, I didn't like it." It would have been nice not to have been charged for it, but alas I consider it a wash of a night and wanted to get out of there as quickly as possible. If you want good burrata, for a third of the price you can get some in the Mercado de San Miguel or for comparative prices but better tasting, try another restaurant. To give the place a bone, since I'm giving it a terrible review, the layout is very hip and I think it could be a fun place for a drinks (not food!) experience with a group of people.

However, the staff was so very gracious, and allowed us to stop at 12 courses and insisted we finish off with one of the signature (out of 3!) desserts and we were glad we did. Some standouts were the anchovy on lavender, presented on top of seaweed in a bowl of lavender dry ice (magnificent presentation!) and the mushroom broth dish which was an amazing umami experience. And that dessert? Take your childhood cotton candy and elevate it by 100 and then serve it as a cloud dotted with tiny orange macarons, gelees and other treats. Wow!

review_preview: With a group of friends I have just had the pleasure of trying three of the top restaurants in Madrid in the same week – Cebo, Etimo and Montes des Galicia.They are all excellent. You should have a very good meal and an enjoyable...
review_full: With a group of friends I have just had the pleasure of trying three of the top restaurants in Madrid in the same week – Cebo, Etimo and Montes des Galicia. They are all excellent. You should have a very good meal and an enjoyable evening in each of them. We did.  The menu and quality of food and presentation at Etimo was outstanding. It was imaginative, delicate, mouth watering and thoroughly enjoyable. It must be the best in Madrid. The table service was a bit hesitant (reflecting the fact that the restaurant has only been open 5 months) but the Chef and Maitre ensured this did not affect overall service. The menu at Montes was brilliant mixture of new and familiar. It included a fois gras starter, a favourite of mine, and the sirloin steak melted in the mouth. The service was excellent. Wine flowed like water. The whole evening was a delightful entertainment. Cebu was by far the best for classical service and for elegance but I found the set menu rather too experimental for my taste and some of the flavours extreme. In my personal opinion, last week Etimo was first for food, closely followed by Montes. Cebo was first for classical service. And Montes was first for all-round fun and engagement.

review_preview: Mas Al Sur was just a 5 minute walk fromour hotel. When we arrived we were shown a table right away. Our waiter, Alejandro was fantastic, funny, attentive and professional. Between our poor Spanish and his English we made it work. We ordered mainly...
review_full: Mas Al Sur was just a 5 minute walk from our hotel. When we arrived we were shown a table right away. Our waiter, Alejandro was fantastic, funny, attentive and professional. Between our poor Spanish and his English we made it work. We ordered mainly half dishes for we wanted to capture as many different tastes of the region. Alejandro suggested a great Spanish wine that paired well with our dishes. We had roasted veggies, shrimp cooked with garlic, Mushroom risotto (to die for), Cuban shredded beef and a full order of octopus! Everything was delicious! At the end Alejandro brought us out a small slice of cheesecake and a local liquor like our Bailey’s to finish off the meal! Fantastic!

review_full: I was here with my girlfriend. The food tasted delicious and everything was fresh. The best for us was the service. The waitresses Frank, Anthony and Alejandro did their best to create a wonderful experience for us. After we asked for the bill, we got a chocolate rum and a typical Spanish dessert on the house without paying for it. The prices are fair for what you got, I mean it’s in the center of Madrid and you can’t expect to get anything cheap here. All in all I can say that I enjoyed the time in the restaurant and I can recommend it to anyone. :) Estaba aquí con mi novia. La comida sabe deliciosa y todo era fresco, lo mejor para nosotros fue el servicio, los meseros Frank, Anthony y Alejandro hicieron su mejor y creativa experiencia para nosotros, antes de que preguntáramos por la cuenta, obtuvimos un ron de café y un postro típico de España sin pagar por eso. Los precios son justos para lo que obtengas, quiero decir es en el centro de Madrid y no esperes obtener algo barato aquí. Todo lo que puedo decir es que disfrutamos el tiempo en el restaurante y puedo recomendarlo a todos. ;)

title_review: Great little restaurant with a neighborhood feeling
review_preview: I found this restaurant after viewing multiple reviews on TripAdvisor.  We were looking for simpler but good fare after a sumptuous meal the night before. review_full: I found this restaurant after viewing multiple reviews on TripAdvisor. We were looking for simpler but good fare after a sumptuous meal the night before. This restaurant fit the bill. We had several starters (tapas) including grilled vegetables, Mediterranean salad, and Argentinian empanadas - all great. Two main dishes - deep fried calamari and cod (bacalao). Two drinks, a glass of red wine and aperol spritz, plus sparkling mineral water. Total bill $55 euros for three people. More than enough food for all of us. They brought a slice of cheesecake and Bailey's for three on the house! Kudos to our servers - the Night Team with our primary server Peter. Very attentive. Between his English and our Spanish, we managed to get what we wanted.

title_review: Amazing food and Carla is the best!
review_preview: This place was perfect for our family to stop off at after a flamenco show. Unlike many of the other tapa places we tried, this one had a good mix of fun, busy atmosphere and comfortable personal space. The staff was very comfortable with speaking...
review_full: This place was perfect for our family to stop off at after a flamenco show. Unlike many of the other tapa places we tried, this one had a good mix of fun, busy atmosphere and comfortable personal space. The staff was very comfortable with speaking English and it wasn't long before Carla came over and became our tapa-ordering guru for the evening. She advised us to order half portions of the best dishes and made sure to bring them out in the perfect order to satisfy our palates. Order anything of the daily suggestions menu (because it's guaranteed to be delicious). Off the everyday menu we really enjoyed the curry chicken, the musaka, the tiramisu, and the beet cake. Also do yourself a favor and order a pitched of sangria. It's spectacular and has a full body of flavorful fruit and cinnamon spice. As if Carla couldn't get any better, she brought us out these delightful complimentary shots of watermelon, mint, and vodka. Perfect way to end a very delicious meal.

review_preview: I figured I deserved a treat during finals week, so I decided to try one of the better-rated breakfast spots in Madrid. No regrets, let me tell you. The shakshuka is absolutely delicious, the mix of different textures was divine. It was such a homey...
review_full: I figured I deserved a treat during finals week, so I decided to try one of the better-rated breakfast spots in Madrid. No regrets, let me tell you. The shakshuka is absolutely delicious, the mix of different textures was divine. It was such a homey meal that it kept me noticeably warm for hours.  The place wasn't too busy when I came in, though I imagine it gets a little more populated at night, when the "cocktails" portion of their name kicks in. My only complaint would be that the coffee was a bit on the bitter side, but that's to be expected in most cafes here. Really great, friendly staff, and awesome music. Definitely come here during Winter.

Atmosphere as mentioned a little stressful, but you can shut it out ;) it’s great located! Prices are fair and it’s a fantastic place for groups and families.

review_preview: I’ve been living in Madrid for almost 4 months now, and nothing beats Zenith for brunch. The menu is amazing with so many different options to choose from. I had the eggs benedict with bacon, and there was just the right amount of Hollandaise sauce,...
review_full: I’ve been living in Madrid for almost 4 months now, and nothing beats Zenith for brunch. The menu is amazing with so many different options to choose from. I had the eggs benedict with bacon, and there was just the right amount of Hollandaise sauce, which tasted lovely. I also tried some of my friend’s pancakes, which were fluffy and perfectly cooked. Overall, I would say that the food is good value for money as it tastes great. Staff are all really friendly too, and multilingual (Spanish, English, Portuguese). I will definitely be back here next weekend with another friend!
